title: Legendary Patriots kicker Adam Vinatieri elected to Pro Football Hall of Fame
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Adam Vinatieri, NFL's all-time scoring leader, elected to Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2026.
Vinatieri's career included four Super Bowl wins, three with Patriots and one with Colts.
Vinatieri joins fellow kickers Morten Andersen and Jan Stenerud in the Pro Football Hall of Fame.

title: Drake Maye loses MVP race to Matthew Stafford by razor-thin margin
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye finished second to Matthew Stafford in the NFL MVP race, losing by one first-place vote.
Matthew Stafford received 24 first-place votes, totaling 366 points; Drake Maye earned 23 votes, totaling 361 points.
Maye led the Patriots to a 14-3 record, while Stafford led the league in passing yards and touchdowns.

title: Mike Vrabel named 2025 NFL Coach of the Year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel named 2025 NFL Coach of the Year at NFL Honors ceremony for leading the Patriots to the Super Bowl.
This is Vrabel's second Coach of the Year award, previously winning in 2021 with the Tennessee Titans.
Vrabel transformed the Patriots, who went 17-3, from back-to-back four-win seasons to Super Bowl contenders.

title: Unlike Tom Brady, Tedy Bruschi has a dog in the Patriots-Seahawks fight
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tedy Bruschi expressed strong support for the Patriots in their Super Bowl LX matchup against the Seahawks.
Bruschi cited his friendship with coach Mike Vrabel as a key reason for his loyalty to the Patriots.
Tom Brady remained neutral about the game, contrasting with some former teammates' clear partisan stances.

title: Pedestrian struck by police cruiser at UMass Lowell, officials say
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A pedestrian was hit by a police cruiser near UMass Lowell's South Campus on Thursday evening.
The incident occurred around 6:30 p.m. near the intersection of Wilder and Bachelder Streets.
Lowell and Massachusetts State Police are investigating; counseling resources are offered to affected UMass Lowell community members.

title: New Bedford police investigate after man goes missing, drowns in harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Vasquez, 51, was found dead in New Bedford Harbor on January 31, three days after he was last seen.
Vasquez was last seen on January 28 after visiting a local adult establishment, and reported missing on January 30.
New Bedford and Massachusetts State Police are investigating, but no foul play has been indicated in the drowning.

title: Cambridge brewery workers plan to unionize, file for election
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Lamplighter Brewing Co. workers in Cambridge filed for a union election with United Food and Commercial Workers Local 1445.
The brewery operates two taprooms in Cambridge, located at 284 Broadway and 110 North First St.
Bartenders Owen Murray and Ryan McFarland support unionizing to ensure workers' perspectives are considered in industry changes.

title: Patriots OC Josh McDaniels named AP Assistant Coach of the Year
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Josh McDaniels won the AP Assistant Coach of the Year for transforming Patriots' offense to second-highest scoring in NFL.
Under McDaniels, the Patriots' offense improved from 17 to 28.8 points per game and ranked third in total yards.
Patriots QB Drake Maye praised McDaniels for his guidance, as Maye emerged as a top MVP candidate this season.

title: Patriots, Seahawks both have defensive starters missing from practice
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots linebacker Harold Landry III missed Thursday's practice due to a knee injury, while Robert Spillane was limited.
Seahawks safety Nick Emmanwori did not practice Thursday following an ankle injury sustained on Wednesday.
Seahawks coach Mike Macdonald expects Emmanwori to play after participating in a walkthrough on Thursday.

title: NY man allegedly stole $325K in seafood from Worcester warehouse in 1 of several heists
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Romoy Forbes, 31, faces charges for allegedly stealing $325,000 of snow crabs from a Worcester warehouse.
Forbes is accused of stealing frozen snow crab, blueberries, and $400,000 of designer cologne in three heists.
The U.S. Attorney's Office states Forbes could face up to 10 years for interstate transportation of stolen goods.
